title: Accumulation of area under a radical function part - c

content.question: Rather than using the line x = 6 as in part (a), consider the line x = w , where w can be any number greater than 3. Let A(w) be the area of the region enclosed by the graph of f, the x-axis, and the vertical line x = w . Write an integral expression for A(w).

frqParts.text: Rather than using the line x = 6 as in part (a), consider the line x = w , where w can be any number greater than 3. Let A(w) be the area of the region enclosed by the graph of f, the x-axis, and the vertical line x = w . Write an integral expression for A(w).

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
